name: 施岳廷
objective: This course aims to teach students the fundamental knowledge of ceramic materials. It will start from the introduction of ceramic materials including bonding, structure, and defects. Afterward, important properties of ceramics including electrical, dielectric, magnetic, and optical properties will be discussed.
schedule:
1. Ceramic Crystal Structures
2. Glassy State and Glass Formation Principles
3. Glass Compositions and Structures
4. Defects in Ceramics 
5. Mass and Electrical Transport 
6. Dielectric, Magnetic, and Optical Properties 
7. Thermal Properties
materials:
1.	W. D. Kingery, H. K. Bowen and D. R. Uhlmann, Introduction to Ceramics. (Wiley, 1976).
2.	Y. M. Chiang, D. P. Birnie and W. D. Kingery, Physical Ceramics: Principles for Ceramic Science and Engineering. (Wiley, 1996).
3.	M. Barsoum and M. W. Barsoum, Fundamentals of Ceramics. (Taylor & Francis, 2002).
